text:
how do I evaluate an expr developed in package Utils in the computational context of a client's unknown package using a function or macro exported from Utils
```module Utils
export @genstruct

macro genstruct()
   provide(expr)
end

expr = 
:($(Expr(:toplevel, quote
    begin
        struct StructA <: Any
            a::Int64
        end
    end
end)))

end # module

module Client
  using Utils
  @genstruct(true)
  StructA(...)
end 

# if it is better, makes things simpler, 
expr =
:(Expr(:toplevel, $(Expr(:quote, quote
    begin
        struct StructA <: Any
            a::Int64
        end
    end
end))))```

text: Do you need an `esc` in there?
where? I don't what `provide` should be.

I had tried many variations before asking --
I can create the struct as part of Utils: `Utils.StructA` 
I need the struct to be directly available within Client: `Client.StructA`
